sources.title: Tangled Destinies
sources.description: After an airliner makes a forced landing at night in the desert, the passengers take refuge in a large unoccupied house. It is not long before one of them is mysteriously murdered.

sources.title: Tangled Destinies (1932) [Adventure] [Comedy]
sources.description:
"Tangled Destinies" is a 1932 American film directed by Frank R. Strayer. The film is also known as "Who Killed Harvey Forbes?" in the United Kingdom. 

---

Directed by Frank R. Strayer, produced by Ralph M. Like, written by Edward T. Lowe Jr. (story and adaptaion), starring Gene Morgan as Capt. Randall "Randy" Gordon, Doris Hill as Doris, Glenn Tryon as Tommy Preston, the Co-pilot, Vera Reynolds as Ruth (the Airline Stewardess), Ethel Wales as Prudence Daggott, Monaei Lindley as Monica van Buren, Syd Saylor as Buchanan (the Prizefighter), Sidney Bracey as McGinnis (posing as Professor Marmont), Lloyd Whitlock as Floyd Martin, James B. Leong as Ling, William P. Burt as Harvey Forbes, Henry Hall as Dr. Wingate (the Parson) and William Humphrey as Professor Hartley.

---

Source: "Tangled Destinies" Wikipedia, The Free Encyclopedia. Wikimedia Foundation, Inc.. 13 January 2012. Web. 3 August 2012. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tangled_Destinies.

If you like this movie and our channel, please subscribe: https://goo.gl/0qDmXe

sources.title: Tangled Destinies (1932)
sources.description: I've been researching newly public domain films from 1929 and earlier, along with other pictures of the era that I find interesting, so I'm uploading the best possible copies that I can find. This low-budget mystery only really has one claim to fame: being one of the few films from the year that entered the public domain early. That said, it does have a few interesting tidbits around it. It was one of the earliest films selected for television broadcast in 1942, and also stars Chinese-American actor James B. Leong in a minor role. It follows a group aboard a passenger plane that makes an emergency landing, only to discover that one of them is a killer.Â

sources.title: Tangled Destinies (1932) PRE-CODE HOLLYWOOD
sources.description:
Stars: Gene Morgan, Doris Hill, Glenn Tryon 
Director: Frank R. Strayer

After an airliner makes a forced night landing in the desert, some of the passengers are murdered. A detective guarding one of the murdered passengers -- who was also carrying a bag of now missing diamonds -- must find out which of the passengers is the killer!

metadata.Plot: An airliner makes a forced landing at night in the desert. The passengers and crew take refuge in a nearby deserted house. Soon some of the passengers are found murdered, and one of the passengers reveals himself to be a detective who was guarding one of the murdered passengers, who was carrying a bag of diamonds--which is now missing. The detective must find out which of the passengers is the killer.
metadata.Actors: Gene Morgan, Doris Hill, Glenn Tryon
